docs.lead_paragraph: A picture on April 20 with the Big City column, about efforts to reduce Caesarean sections, showed Dr. Mitchell A. Maiman, the chairman of the obstetrics and gynecology department at Staten Island University Hospital, at his job. But the woman in the picture with Dr. Maiman, who does not offer elective Caesarean sections, was not his patient and the situation was posed. Under The Times's guidelines, pictures of news situations should not be staged. Had editors known the details, the picture would not have been used.

docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (National Geographic) NAKED SCIENCE: ICELAND VOLCANO ERUPTION The eruption of Eyjafjallajokull in Iceland, above, with its 30,000-foot plume of ash, created chaos not only in the air but also on the ground, causing major flooding (it melted a glacier) and extensive evacuations. This program looks inside the volcano during and after its most recent eruption, and explains its unpredictability -- and why it could lead to a disturbance at the nearby Katla volcano, which is thought to be even more volatile. 7 A.M. (ABC) GOOD MORNING AMERICARobert Downey Jr. promotes ''Iron Man 2'' alongside Elton John and Jeanne White-Ginder, the mother Ryan White, who died of AIDS. Mr. Downey moves to ''Live With Regis and Kelly'' at 9.
